title: Google\Cloud\ManagedIdentities\V1beta1\Trust
name: Trust
description:
Represents a relationship between two domains. This allows a controller in one domain to authenticate a user in another domain.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.managedidentities.v1beta1.Trust

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.target_domain_name
params.description: The fully qualified target domain name which will be in trust with the current domain.

params.name: data.trust_type
params.description: The type of trust represented by the trust resource.

params.name: data.trust_direction
params.description: The trust direction, which decides if the current domain is trusted, trusting, or both.

params.name: data.selective_authentication
params.description: The trust authentication type, which decides whether the trusted side has forest/domain wide access or selective access to an approved set of resources.

params.name: data.target_dns_ip_addresses
params.description: The target DNS server IP addresses which can resolve the remote domain involved in the trust.

params.name: data.trust_handshake_secret
params.description: Input only. The trust secret used for the handshake with the target domain. It will not be stored.

params.name: data.create_time
params.description: Output only. The time the instance was created.

params.name: data.update_time
params.description: Output only. The last update time.

params.name: data.state
params.description: Output only. The current state of the trust.

params.name: data.state_description
params.description: Output only. Additional information about the current state of the trust, if available.

params.name: data.last_trust_heartbeat_time
params.description: Output only. The last heartbeat time when the trust was known to be connected.
